title: Scratch 2014 Janaca Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a lot of snappy energy to this bottling by Sabrine Rodems, with fresh garden herbs, blackberries, shaved licorice and a dark chocolate touch on the nose, with a lingering, exotic Indian-like spice throughout. Wild sagebrush and pine oil show on the sip, giving depth to the tangy purple fruit. Squeaky tannins rise toward the finish.

title: Sixto 2014 Roza Hills Chardonnay (Washington)
description: This wine comes from old vines planted at high elevation. A light-gold color, aromas of toast, peach, pumpkin spice and wet rock are followed by plentiful stone and tropical-fruit flavors speckled with barrel spices, showing superb length on the flavorful finish. It has an absolutely swoon-worthy feel. More please! Best from 2019–2024.

title: Stift Klosterneuburg 2016 Ried Jungherrn Weissburgunder (Vienna)
description: A mere glint of orange peel accents the subtle creaminess already apparent on the nose of this wine. Yeasty complexity and richness characterizes the concentrated palate. Bright lemon notes pervade those rich layers with freshness, finishing with dry, lip-smacking clarity.

title: Weszeli 2015 Purus Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: A slight funkiness accompanies the salty yeast notes on the nose of this wine. The funk disappears on the lithe and elegant palate as wonderfully pure notes of green pear and a moreish lick of sage, ivy, moss and fern combine. A lovely and irresistible flavor combination.

title: Vik 2011 La Piu Belle Red (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Ripe dark concentrated aromas of blackberry, prune, charcoal and chocolate are heady. This blend of Cabernet, Carmenère and other red grapes feels solid and tannic. Spicy plum and berry flavors are typically herbal, while chocolate and herb notes carry the finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Vik 2012 Milla Cala Red (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Up-front oak creates a warm sense of toast and maple to go with herbal leathery berry aromas. A bold lively palate hosts coffee, mocha and herbal plum and berry flavors. On the finish, this is toasty with a long-lasting note of mocha. Drink through 2021.

title: Bonterra 2015 The Roost Blue Heron Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: A deep gold color and bold buttery aromas set up an expectation for rich flavors, which come in the form of butter, butterscotch, vanilla and cream, with some tasty Anjou pear underneath. The wine was made from biodynamic grapes and matured in French oak barrels, making it full bodied, mouthfilling and indulgent.

title: Clos des Fous 2014 Grillos Cantores Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Aromas of cool earth, fall leaves and mossy plum and red-berry fruits lead to a palate with grip and flush tannins. Flavors of mocha and chocolate are mild and don't overcrowd the wine's primary berry character. This is excellent Cabernet for the price; drink through 2022.

title: Cutruzzola 2014 Giacomino Reserve Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Thick blackberries, wet slate, sweet anise and a touch of purple flowers show on the rich nose of this reserve wine from a vineyard tucked into a seaside canyon above Cambria. It's quite dry on the tip of sip, with tons of rose petals and lavender, and then the black cherry and vanilla flavors arise. Chalky tannins and refreshing acidity complete the picture.

title: Davies 2015 Piedra Libre Vineyards Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a concentrated, fleshy coastal wine, weighty in oak and tannin. The vibrancy comes via well-defined layers of cherry, wild strawberry and forest, with wisps of black tea and cardamom knocking on the door.

title: Domaine du Penlois 2016 Sous l'Aile du Moulin  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: This wine is produced from vines grown beside the moulin of Moulin-à-Vent (windmill). It has plenty of structured tannins as well as dense black fruits, making it both rich and ageworthy. It's impressive with its dark plum fruit and dry core. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine du Vieux Lazaret 2013 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Sun-kissed strawberries and red cherries are edged in leather and dried herbs in this buoyant, juicy wine. While rich and silken in texture, it offers freshness on the midpalate and fine, firm tannins that lend vibrance. It drinks well now but should improve through 2025.

title: Ebner-Ebenauer 2016 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: This is restrained, giving away just a bit of lemon zestiness before a more herbal touch of celery salt appears. On the surface, the fluid palate is all about easygoing pear fruit, but there is a deeper layer that has yet to wake up. It promises salt and spice—the edges of tingling white pepper are proof.

title: Experience 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is soft, smooth and brightly focused in acidity. The palate offers a sanguine notion, with cassis and meat tones that are highlighted by cinnamon. A persistent freshness prevails on the finish.

title: Furthermore 2014 Gioia Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Inviting in warm aromas and flavors of baked cherry cobbler, this medium-bodied wine offers firm focused acidity built around well-developed highlights of cardamom, cinnamon, orange peel and cola. It's lengthy and complex.

title: Istine 2015 Vigna Cavarchione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, new leather, culinary spice and a whiff of pressed violet lift out of the glass. Chewy and savory, the medium-bodied palate doles out raspberry compote, ripe Marasca cherry, cinnamon and star anise. Polished tannins provide smooth support.

title: Las Positas 2013 Estate Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)
description: Bursting with ripe, almost jammy fruit flavors, this exuberant wine from an often-outstanding estate is rich and mouthfilling, full bodied but not too tannic to easily enjoy. Flavors run the gamut from blackberry to Bing cherry to blueberry and espresso.

title: Loimer 2015 Dechant Langenlois Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)
description: A gamy, earthy hint plays on the nose, while the palate reveals a rich seam of tart, red cherry fruit. Freshness and a web of superfine but firm tannins allow the fruit to shine and glow without stealing any of its limelight or purity. This is firm and graceful, with the merest sprinkling of rusticity. Lovely now but will evolve. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2016 Nussberg Riesling (Vienna)
description: Tender hints of orange peel make this evocative. On the palate, zesty lemon notes highlight the pithiness. It's slender in body, refreshing and ripe but dry. The long finish is supercharged with lemon. Lovely now, it has the potential to age. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Mi Sueño 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From a variety of vineyard sources, this 100% varietal wine highlights deft winemaking in its ability to offer plenty of power within a context of vibrancy. Raspberry, cherry and milk chocolate meet savory touches of clove and cinnamon, with plenty of structure within its rounded richness.

title: Mommessin 2016 Les Grandes Mises Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: One in a series of small-batch production wines from this major producer, this comes from the top vineyard of Côte du Py. The bold tannins and strong mineral texture are typical of this vineyard. Combined with black plum and berry fruits, the wine becomes rich, dense and worthy of aging. Drink from 2019.
designation: Les Grandes Mises Côte du Py

title: Monte Bernardi 2015 Retromarcia  (Chianti Classico)
description: This fragrant red offers heady scents of ripe dark-skinned berry, pressed violet, eucalyptus and a potpourri of culinary spice. The refined palate is initially understated but then sneaks up on you with ripe wild cherry, cranberry, licorice and clove. It's surprisingly fresh for such a hot, dry vintage and balanced, with firm, refined tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Nellcôte 2016 Rosé (Mount Veeder)
description: This wine is made from nearly equal parts Malbec and Syrah, grown on Bald Mountain Ranch atop this feral appellation. It succeeds in offering dry complexity around a core of refreshing and lightly spiced raspberry and Rainier cherry. Lengthy, it lasts for days, offering medium-bodied power.

title: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014  Barbaresco
description: Classic varietal aromas of young Nebbiolo include woodland berry, freshly picked violet and a whiff of tilled soil fill the glass. The fresh, elegant palate delivers red cherry, strawberry, star anise and a hint of graphite set against vibrant acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: R&A; Pfaffl 2015 Altenberg Reserve St. Laurent (Niederösterreich)
description: The nose presents wonderfully ripe, fleshy and juicy notes of red and black cherry. The full-flavored palate, rich with finely-woven tannin, adds to this impression of fleshy, richness even more but keeps its balance with well-judged, bright crunchy freshness. Hints of cinnamon and plum only add to the generous feel. The grippy but smooth tannins suggest that this will develop. Drink 2020–2025.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Del Arroyo Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Livermore Valley)
description: An exotic treat, this dry wine overflows with mango and marshmallow aromas, has tasty lemon meringue flavors and a soothing, viscous texture that coats the palate. Winemaker Shauna Rosenblum kept the juice on the skins for four days during fermentation, adding to the wine's concentration, layering and complexity as well as a lingering, honeyed finish.

title: S.R. Tonella 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Quince and grapefruit flavors rise to the top of the palate in this well-made estate wine, aged in a mix of French oak, Acacia and stainless steel. While smooth and round in feel, its acidity has impact, providing stony refreshment around a lingering white peach flavor.

title: Santa Carolina 2015 Reserva de Familia Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Elegance mixed with bold fruit is what this overachieving Cabernet is about. Aromas of blackberry, dried black plum, spice and cocoa suggest high quality. A focused palate and textural grip holds cherry and cassis flavors that are ripe and backed by notes of chocolate and coffee. Drink through 2022.

title: Schandl 2015 Cabernet Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc (Burgenland)
description: Plump fruit, ripe plum, cinnamon and blueberry appear on the nose. These notions unite on a dense, but rather fresh body where the grip of tannin is only revealed on the finish. It is countered by ample fruit and freshness that give a feeling of juicy, smooth roundness. A balanced and harmonious red that stays on the refreshing side.

title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2015 Reserve Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)
description: There is an intriguing, aromatic quality of nettle amidst the ripe, red cherry flavors on the nose. The palate has an inviting, sinuous slenderness, with still slightly grippy but fine tannin. Red cherry ripples across the palate, given precision and vibrancy by lovely, taut freshness. Such an elegant but lively wine, full of joy and measure.
